title: sdras/awesome-actions
content: Actions are triggered by GitHub platform events directly in a repo and run on-demand workflows as autoscaled containers in response. With GitHub Actions you can automate your workflow from idea to production. Please don't hesitate to make a PR if you have more resources to share.

title: moncho/dry
content: Dry is a terminal application to manage Docker. It shows information about Containers, Images and Networks, and, if running a Docker Swarm, it also shows all kinds of information about the state of the Swarm cluster. It can connect to both local or remote Docker daemons.

title: The difference between aria-label and aria-labelledby

title: Researchers Can Duplicate Keys from the Sounds They Make in Locks

Basically, if your hands or wrists hurt or go numb or tingle, that may be RSI.

title: Sail Freight Projects Around the World

title: 11 reasons to visit Lordship Lane, East Dulwich, SE22

title: The History of the URL

title: 30 Movies That Are Unlike Anything You’ve Seen Before
content: These films, each unforgettable in its own way, are essential viewing. The word unique has to be one of the most overused descriptors in show business; if every movie that got touted as one-of-a-kind by its marketing team actually was, there’d be no further complaints about Hollywood creativity.

title: Where Do Eels Come From?
content: In the spring of 1876, a young man of nineteen arrived in the seaside city of Trieste and set about a curious task. Every morning, as the fishermen brought in their catch, he went to meet them at the port, where he bought eels by the dozens and then the hundreds.

title: 12 Underknown Songs From the Region That Birthed Emo
content: The Washington, D.C., punk scene (and its surrounding suburbs) figured out what happened after hardcore. What happened after that was out of its hands. To mention the subgenre known grudgingly as “emo” is to argue about the term’s parameters or even its existence.

title: The Prophecies of Q
content: American conspiracy theories are entering a dangerous new phase. If you were an adherent, no one would be able to tell. You would look like any other American. You could be a mother, picking leftovers off your toddler’s plate. You could be the young man in headphones across the street.
